protected.name: Protection Site
checkpoint.disable.warning.text: Recovery point-in-time checkpoint option is not supported when differential reverse option is enabled for VMware site. Please opt either of point-in-time checkpoint or differential reverse replication
checkpoint.preserve.info: Please provide reason to preserve checkpoint of following virtual machines :
checkpoint.warn.retain.greterthan.interv: As per current recovery point configuration, {{recoveryPointCopies}} copies in {{durationNum}} {{durationUnit}}, leads to {{checkpointCopyCreationTime}} (Recovery Point Interval) and each copy will be retained for {{retaintion}}(s).Retain For should be greater than Recovery Point Interval. Please provide valid retain for field.
As per current recovery point configuration, {{recoveryPointCopies}} copies in {{durationNum}} {{durationUnit}}, leads to {{checkpointCopyCreationTime}} (Recovery Point Interval). Configured Replication Interval (RPO) is {{time}} {{unit}}. Recovery point Interval must be in multiples of Replication Interval (RPO). Please reconfigure Recovery Point Configuration.
checkpoint.info: Point-in-time checkpoints will be generated every {{checkpointCopyCreationTime}} from the replicated data and it will be retained for {{retaintion}}(s). A maximum of {{maxCheckpointPossible}} checkpoints will be created in the recovery site for each protected virtual machine. Existing checkpoints will not be removed until a new one is successfully created, even if they pass their scheduled expiration time.

report.pdf.title: Datamotive Solution Report | © {{year}} All Rights Reserved | Confidential | www.datamotive.io
license.drag.drop: Drop license file here or click to upload.
license.validated.readyto.install: License file validated successfully, click install to apply license
take.action.tooltip.vm.disk.operation: Take action will acknowledge the alert and protection plan will be updated with the disk changes. The changes will automatically synchronize on recovery site in the next iteration.
take.action.tooltip.vm.reconfigure.opera: Take action will acknowledge the alert and will open the edit protection plan window through which you can modify the impacted virtual machine configuration. The changes will automatically synchronize on recovery site in the next iteration.
vm.remove.description: Virtual machine will be removed in the next replication iteration of running protection plan.
create.sites.tooltip: Minimum two sites are required. One for the protection and other for recovery
configure.nodes.tooltip: Minimum two management nodes are required
protect.workloads.tooltip: 1 or more DR plans or move groups.
dashboard.bandwidth.usage.title: Bandwidth Usage ( Last 12 hours )
vm.alerts.warning: Note: The following alerts will be addressed and acknowledged by this operation.
info.site.type: Select the site type. Supported site types are Protection and Recover
info.encryption.wire: Wire encryption protects data as it moves into, through, and out of any network
info.site.platform.type: Site platform type. supported types are VMware, AWS, GCP and Azure
info.site.node: Primary node through which replication or recovery will be managed
info.site.azurehost: Host server IP address For Azure
info.site.region: Cloud site region where management server is deployed and Protection needs to be done
info.site.availZone: Cloud site zone where management server is deployed and protection needs to be done
info.site.name: Name for the site
info.site.access.key: Access keys consist of an access key ID and secret access key. These keys will be encrypted and stored in the database and will be used to perform any required operation on AWS
info.site.secrete.key: Access keys consist of an access key ID and secret access key. These keys will be encrypted and stored in the database and will be used to perform any required operation on AWS
info.site.port: vCenter server port on which the management service is running. Example 443
info.site.gcp.projectid: The project ID is a unique identifier for a gcp project
info.site.storage.acc: Provide Azure storage account from same region as site region.
info.node.name: Name of the deployed node VM or instance
info.node.platformType: Platform type on which node is deployed. Supported platform types are VMware, AWS and GCP
info.node.hostname: IP address or FQDN of the node
info.node.mgmt.port: Port on which management service is running
info.node.replicationCtrlPort: Port on which replication controller service is running
info.node.replicationDataPort: Port on which replication data service is running
info.node.encryption.key: Node encryption key for wire transfer. To get the valid key, open the remote site and navigate to  'Configure -> Nodes'. Click on eye icon against the local management node.
info.node.type: Node type, Replication - The node will act as a stateless replication unit and will handle provided replication operations. Dedupe - Node to perform deduplication of data. Management - Node will act as a management server.
info.protectionplan.protectedSite: Choose site where workload to be protected resides
info.protectionplan.recoverySite: Choose site where workload will get recovered
info.protectionplan.instance.tags.aws: A tag is a label that you or AWS assigns to an AWS resource. Each tag consists of a key and a value. For each resource, each tag key must be unique, and each tag key can have only one value. You can use tags to organize your resources, and cost allocation tags to track your AWS costs on a detailed level.
info.protectionplan.instance.type: Instance types comprise varying combinations of CPU, memory, storage, and networking capacity.
info.protectionplan.instance.volume.type: The SSD-backed volumes provided fall into these categories: 1. General Purpose SSD (GP2 and GP3) — Provides a balance of price and performance. 2 . Provisioned IOPS SSD(IO2 and IO3) — Provides high performance for mission-critical, low-latency, or high-throughput workloads.
info.protectionplan.instance.volume.iops: The requested number of I/O operations per second that the volume can support.
info.protectionplan.network.aws.subnet: A subnet is a range of IP addresses in your VPC. You can launch AWS resources, such as EC2 instances, into a specific subnet.
info.protectionplan.network.aws.public: Requests a public IP address from Amazon's public IP address pool, to make your instance reachable from the Internet. In most cases, the public IP address is associated with the instance until it’s stopped or terminated, after which it’s no longer available for you to use. If you require a persistent public IP address that you can associate and disassociate at will, use an Elastic IP address (EIP) instead. You can allocate your own EIP, and associate it to your instance after launch.
info.protectionplan.network.aws.privatei: A private IPv4 address is an IP address that's not reachable over the Internet. You can use private IPv4 addresses for communication between instances in the same VPC. To provide secondary ip address provide comma separated ip addresses.
info.protectionplan.network.aws.security: A security group acts as a virtual firewall for your EC2 instances to control incoming and outgoing traffic. Inbound rules control the incoming traffic to your instance, and outbound rules control the outgoing traffic from your instance
info.protectionplan.boot.delay: Delay in seconds between two boot order
info.protectionplan.encryption.wire: Wire encryption enables confidentiality and security while transferring data between two sites.
info.protectionplan.isCompression: Compressing data can save storage capacity, speed up data transfer, and decrease costs for storage hardware and network bandwidth.
info.protectionplan.isDedupe: Deduplication eliminate duplicate copies of repeating data over the network. Useful while moving data out from any cloud environment to trim egress cost.
info.protectionplan.enable.reverse: Allow differential replication of recovered virtual machines when replicating back to original source
info.protectionplan.startTime: Time from when the protection plan will start virtual machine replication
info.protectionplan.replPreScript: Protection plan replication pre script, will get executed before any virtual machine snapshots are created.
info.protectionplan.replPostScript: Protection plan replication post script will get execute dafter all selected virtual machines snapshots are completed.
info.protectionplan.preScript: Protection plan recovery pre script will get executed before any virtual machine recovery.
info.protectionplan.postScript: Protection plan recovery post script will get executed after all selected virtual machines are recovered.
info.protectionplan.scriptTimeout: Timeout in seconds for pre-script and post-script
info.protectionplan.instance.prescript: Virtual machine pre script will get execute before the virtual machine recovery
info.protectionplan.instance.postscript: Virtual machine post script will get execute after the virtual machine recovery
info.script.description: Summarize your script's purpose and key features briefly.
info.email.address: Email address, this email address will be used to send the email notifications
info.email.password: Credentials for the provided email address
info.email.skip.ssl: Verify the SSL certificate provided by the smtp email server
info.email.replicate.config: Replicate the configuration on the all connected sites
info.email.recipient.event: Events for which email notifications will be sent to the recipient
info.throttling.time.limit.start: Start time for the time based throttling
info.throttling.time.limit.end: End time for the time based throttling
info.recovery.system.agent: For AWS, install OS agents like EC2Launch and SSMAgents (Supported for Windows operating system only). For GCP, install google os-config and compute-engine agents. For VMware install VMware-tools (Supported for Windows operating system only). For Azure, install Azure VM Agent
info.recovery.install.cloud.packages: For AWS. install AWS Cloud SDK and for GCP, install GCP Cloud SDK
info.recovery.remove.windows.ad: Restricts the recovered VM/s to join Active Directory Domain on first boot if it was configured with Active Directory Domain on source
info.protectionplan.network.gcp.external: An external IP address associated with this instance. Select an unused static IP address or choose 'Ephemeral' to use an IP from a shared ephemeral IP address pool.
info.protectionplan.network.gcp.privatei: Leave blank to assign an address from the network range or provide ip from the network range
info.protectionplan.network.gcp.subnet: Subnet used to allocate ip address to the instance.
info.protectionplan.network.gcp.network: Network used to allocate ip address to the instance.
info.protectionplan.network.aws.elastici: An Elastic IP address is a reserved public IP address that you can assign to any EC2 instance in a particular region.
info.protectionplan.tags.aws.tags.copy: Add all source system tags in the protected instance
info.protectionplan.network.aws.vpc: Launch recovery instance into the Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC).
info.test.recovery.cleanupTestRecoveries: Cleanup all previously test recovered instances
info.test.recovery.runPPlanScripts: Run protection plan pre and post recovery scripts.
info.copy.config: Copy virtual machines configuration to other machines of this plan.
info.node.password.change: Update Datamotive system users (dmadmin, dmsupport) credentials
info.protectionplan.network.vmware.stati: Select for configuring static network settings for Guest OS. Requires VMware Tools installed. Refer user guide for supported configurations.
info.checkpoint.retention period: Specify how long checkpoint should be retained in the target infrastructure
info.checkpoint.duration: Specify how many number of checkpoints should be created in a given time period
title.network.name: Network
title.node.name: Node Name
info.aws.create.network.from.source: Creates new subnet and security group on recovery site based on protected entity's configuration
info.protectionplan.protection.prescript: Script will execute before every replication iteration.
info.protectionplan.protection.postscrip: Script will execute after successful completion of every replication iteration.
info.protectionplan.volume.type.gcp: Storage space is much less expensive for a standard persistent disk. An SSD persistent disk is better for random IOPS or streaming throughput with low latency.
info.protectionplan.network.aws.availZon: Instance cloud availability zone in which subnet is located
info.protectionplan.instance.tags.gcp: You can set custom metadata for an instance or project outside of the server-defined metadata. This is useful for passing in arbitrary values to your project or instance that can be queried by your code on the instance.
info.vmware.folder.location: Datacenter or folder where the recovery virtual machine should be placed
info.vmware.compute: Standalone Host or Host Cluster where the recovery VM should be created
info.vmware.storage: Storage where the recovery virtual machine's files and disks should be stored
info.vmware.cpu: Number of processors for the recovery virtual machine
info.vmware.network: Select the Network for virtual machine
info.vmware.adapter.type: Select the adapter type for virtual machine
info.vmware.mac.address: Add Mac Address for virtual machine
info.vmware.ip.address: Add IP Address for virtual machine
info.protectionplan.instance.network.tag: Network tags enables to make firewall rules and routes applicable to instance.
info.test.recovery.cleanup: All test recovered copies for following virtual machines will be deleted.
info.auto.migration: Auto migrate workflow will perform following operations on the selected workloads. 1. Power Off 2. Initiate one replication cycle to ensure there is no change data. 3. Initiate Migration.
info.auto.migration.note: Auto migrate workflow will perform following operations on the selected workloads.
info.auto.migration.step-2: 2. Initiate one replication cycle to ensure there is no change data.
info.protectionplan.resource.group.azure: A resource group is a collection of resources that share the same lifecycle, permissions, and policies.
info.protectionplan.availibility.zone.az: You can optionally specify an availability zone in which to deploy your VM.
info.protectionplan.volume.type.azure: Azure managed disks types to support your workload. These are locally redundant storage which is replicated within a single datacenter
info.protectionplan.tags.azure: Tags are name/value pairs that enable you to categorize resources
info.protectionplan.network.azure.networ: Virtual networks are logically isolated from each other in Azure. You can configure their IP address ranges, subnets, route tables, gateways, and security settings, much like a traditional network in your datacenter.
info.protectionplan.network.azure.subnet: A subnet is a range of IP addresses in your virtual network, which can be used to isolate virtual machines from each other or from the Internet.
info.protectionplan.network.azure.extern: Use a public IP address if you want to communicate with the virtual machine from outside the virtual network. Select 'Auto' for dynamic public IP or choose from the IP list for static Public IP.
info.protectionplan.network.azure.securi: A network security group contains security rules that allow or deny inbound network traffic to, or outbound network traffic from, the virtual machine
info.protectionplan.vmsize.azure: Select a VM size to support the workload that you want to run. The size that you choose then determines factors such as processing power, memory, and storage capacity
info.protectionplan.resource.guest.os: Instance operating system. Auto detected based on the corresponding protected instance.
info.protectionplan.resource.firmware: FirmwareType: Select 'BIOS' for traditional systems or 'UEFI' for modern interfaces. The FirmwareType on target has to be same as source for the GuestOS boot. UEFI Secure (uefi_secure): Enables UEFI firmware with added security protocols for verified boot processes. UEFI vTPM (uefi_vTPM): UEFI firmware with Virtual Trusted Platform Module for enhanced hardware-based security features. UEFI Secure vTPM (uefi_secure_vTPM): Combines UEFI Secure Boot and vTPM for maximum security and integrity of the boot process.
info.protectionplan.instance.volume.encr: The AWS Key Management Service (KMS) is a comprehensive solution for creating and managing encryption keys to secure your data. Important Note: Once encryption is enabled for an instance, it cannot be reversed. Additionally, disk encryption on the target depends on the source disks being encrypted.
info.protectionplan.enable.replication.s: Enables all virtual machines in this protection plan to be replicated with similar sync time. Without this option, a virtual machine's replication will try to get scheduled at the configured RPO, irrespective of the other virtual machine's replication status
test.recovery.staticIP.warning: If Static IP is configured, make sure the provided IP addresses are available.
checkpoint.auto.migrate.disable: Option to select Recovery checkpoint is disable for auto migration

info.idp.metadataurl: The Metadata URL is used for fetching the necessary information about the Identity Provider (IdP) to establish a SAML-based Single Sign-On (SSO). Either provide Metadata URL or upload Metadata File.
info.idp.metadatafile: The Metadata File is used for setting up the SAML-based Single Sign-On (SSO) with the Identity Provider (IdP). Either provide Metadata URL or upload Metadata File.
info.idp.attr.name: Claim name for username
info.role.mapping: Role mapping is used to map the user roles from the identity provider to the Datamotive roles.
info.enter.username: Username for which password need to be reset
info.system.username: Username used for SSH into datamotive management node
info.system.password: Password used for SSH into system
info.ssh_key: Secure key used for SSH into system
errorMsg.newPassword: Password should have 1 lowercase letter, 1 uppercase letter, 1 number, 1 special character and be at least 8 characters long.
errorMsg.confirmPassword: New password and confirm password does not match
replication.interval.info: Configured replication interval for this protection plan is {{replicationInterval}} minutes, please make sure the checkpoint configuration is multiple of replication intervals
info.user.name: Enter unique username

recovery.checkpoint.onchange.warn: Recovering VMs with different checkpoints may lead to inconsistencies in overall application state. Reverse differential will not be supported when recovered from a checkpoint.
test.recovery.checkpoint.onchange.warn: Recovering VMs with different checkpoints may lead to inconsistencies in overall application state.
playbook.invalidate.error: Playbook is not in-sync with the current plan configuration please download the updated playbook
apply.credentials.error.message: Please select credentials you want to apply to all VMs.
title.troubleshoot.win.description: Troubleshoot the failed recovery for your Windows virtual machine.
title.troubleshoot.symptoms.w1: You observe following symptoms after performing 'Test Recovery' operation in recovery site.
title.troubleshoot.symptoms.recovery.w1: You observe following symptoms after performing 'Recovery' operation in recovery site.
title.troubleshoot.symptoms.w1-1: The machine boots up and shows Windows Repair Options Blue screen. You cannot connect to the recovered instance using RDP. Datamotive recovery job shows Failed in “Powering-on instance” step.
title.troubleshoot.symptoms.w1-2: The machine boots up and gets stuck at boot screen with a Black screen. You cannot connect to the recovered instance using RDP.  Datamotive recovery job shows Failed in “Powering-on instance” step
title.troubleshoot.symptoms.w1-3: There is no instance in recovery site. Datamotive recovery job shows Failed in “Preparing instance for recovery” step.
title.troubleshoot.fix.steps-d: If you encounter above issues, following steps will be useful to troubleshoot and remediate the state of source virtual machine.
title.troubleshoot.fix.steps.recovery-d: If you encounter above issues, following steps will be useful to troubleshoot and remediate the state of recovered virtual machine.
title.troubleshoot.fix.steps-d-env: Following Steps need to be executed on the Windows virtual machine at source infrastructure. All the mentioned commands need to be executed in command prompt opened with an elevated permission.
disk.consistency.check: Verify and Remediate Window System Files
disk.consistency.check-desc: Verify the consistency of Windows System Files using this command.
disk.consistency.check-desc-output: This command validates the Windows system file state. If there are any issues identified, then it also fixes them.
window.consistency.check-desc: Verify the Windows System Health using Windows native tool, Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM), to scan the health of the Windows system.
window.consistancy.issue-b: If the command reports any issues, then correct the errors before the next replication cycle.
window.consistancy.issue-c: While correcting the errors, stop the Datamotive replication for the virtual machine by stopping the Protection Plan of which this virtual machine is part of.
window.consistancy.issue-e: This command can take time to execute depending upon the errors identified in the system.
window.consistency.check-desc-b: Once the command succeeds, restart the stopped protection plan. Let atleast a couple of replication cycles complete for this virtual machine and then retry the recovery operation.
verify.reboot.pending.status: Verify Reboot Pending Status (if there are any pending reboots in the system)
verify.reboot.pending.status-desc: Verify if there are any pending reboots in the system.
verify.reboot.pending.status-desc-a: Stop the Datamotive replication for the virtual machine by stopping the Protection Plan of which this virtual machine is part of.
verify.reboot.pending.status-desc-b: Apply the updates and perform necessary reboots as prescribed by Windows Operating System. Not all updates require a reboot but it is a good practice to reboot the machine once the updates are applied.
verify.reboot.pending.status-desc-c: After the machine has booted-up and is in steady state, verify the status of the updates applied. It should show the updates successfully applied.
verify.reboot.pending.status-desc-d: After validating the updates status, restart the stopped protection plan. Let atleast a couple of replication cycles complete for this virtual machine and then retry the recovery operation.
analyze.component.store-desc: Windows system uses an internal component store to maintain the state of system and package updates. In cases, where there are frequent system updates, the component store can get into inconsistent state temporarily. To verify the state of Component Store,Execute this command in command prompt.
analyze.component.store-desc-a: Execute following command in command prompt.
analyze.component.store-desc-b: If above command output returns “Component Store Cleanup Recommended: Yes”, then cleanup of component store is required.
verify.disk.consistency: Verify the OS disk file system consistency
verify.disk.consistency-2: Remediate OS disk file system consistency
verify.disk.consistency-comd: Verify the OS disk is in consistent state using below command.
verify.disk.consistency-desc: If Output return as Volume C: is Dirty then, the windows operating system has marked the disk state as inconsistent. Replicating and recovering such a disk has high probability of boot failures. To correct the state in source, execute Windows utility, chkdsk, which verifies and corrects any file system errors.
verify.disk.consistency-desc-d: If Output return as Volume D: is Dirty then, the windows operating system has marked the disk state as inconsistent. Replicating and recovering such a disk has high probability of boot failures. To correct the state in source, execute Windows utility, chkdsk, which verifies and corrects any file system errors.
verify.disk.consistency-desc-b: This operation gets executed only on reboot of virtual machine. The time required for completion of this operation highly depends on number of corruptions and the disk size.
validation.point-a: Once the troubleshooting steps are completed, allow at least 2 replication jobs for the remediated virtual machine to complete and retry “Test Recovery” operation.
validation.point-b: If the recovery still fails, then the Windows operating system disk will require Full Sync. Full Sync operation will resync entire data of the operating system disk again. To execute the “Full Sync” operation for the disk,
title.troubleshoot.fix.workflow.steps: The troubleshooting workflow will go over following steps.
title.troubleshoot.fix.workflow.steps-1: 1. Prepare the failed instance OS disk for troubleshooting
title.troubleshoot.fix.workflow.steps-3: Re-attach the OS disk to recovered instance and test
prepare.disk.troubleshooting: Prepare the failed instance OS disk for troubleshooting
prepare.disk.troubleshooting-desc: In this step, the disk of failed instance will be attached to Datamotive Windows Prep Node.
power-on-prep-node: Power-on the Datamotive Windows Prep Node
opretion.failed.steps: If the “Recovery” operation has failed with Symptoms 1 or 2, then
opretion.failed.steps-1-aws: AWS: Go to Volumes & search for volume with name '<VM name>-0'
opretion.failed.steps-1-azure: Azure: Go to resource group where recovery is performed & search for disk with name '<VM name>-0'
opretion.failed.steps-1-vmware: VMware: Detach the OS disk from recovery entity
opretion.failed.steps-3: Attach the disk to Datamotive Windows Prep Node.
opretion.failed.steps.with.syptoms: If the “Recovery” operation has failed with Symptoms 3, then
opretion.failed.steps.with.syptoms-1: Locate storage for operating system disk of failed recovered instance & create volume out of it.
recovery.validation-1: Once the troubleshooting steps are completed, detach the disk from the Prep node and attach it to the recovered instance.
recovery.validation-2-details: Following Steps need to be executed on the Prep Node. All the mentioned commands need to be executed in command prompt opened with an elevated permission.
command.report.issue: If the above command reports any issues, then correct the errors.
command.report.issue-solution: While correcting the errors, stop the Datamotive replication for the virtual machine by stopping the Protection Plan of which this virtual machine is part of.
varify.reboot.pending.status-2: Load SOFTWARE hive from failed OS disk. Name it failed-disk-sw.
varify.reboot.pending.status-4: Verify key “Pending Reboot”. If present, the system’s current state has updates which are not applied.
confirm.package.pending: Confirm which packages are pending to install using command
confirm.package.pending-desc: The packages with State “Install/Uninstall Pending” are the ones which are pending installs.
confirm.package.pending-procced: To proceed further, these updates need to be removed from the system
confirm.package.pending-procced-step-1: After execution of this command Navigate to WinSxS folder inside failed OS disk. E.g. D:\Windows\WinSxS, and then check whether the pending.xml file exists. If it does, rename it to pending.xml.old.
confirm.package.pending-procced-step-2: Revert the registry changes, by loading “COMPONENT” registry hive  from directory D:\Windows\System32\config. Give it a name “failed-disk-component”
confirm.package.pending-procced-step-3: Expand the loaded hive and verify if “PendingXmlIdentifier” exists. If it does, create a backup of the “failed-disk-component” key, and then delete the PendingXmlIdentifier key.
to.correct.state.filesystem-desc: The time required for completion of this operation highly depends on number of corruptions and the disk size.
Recovery.operation.failed.aws-1: The storage will be available under Snapshots. Search for Snapshot named “<Virtual Machine Name>_<DiskID>_REPL_SNAP”. E.g. For virtual machine named “prod-app”, the snapshot name for it’s OS disk will be “prod-app_<DiskID>_REPL_SNAP”.
Recovery.operation.failed.azure-1: The storage will be available under configured “Storage Account”. Go to Storage-Account --> Storage-Browser --> Blob containers à datamotive. Search for PageBlob named  “<Virtual Machine Name>-0-<Unique number>.vhd.
Recovery.operation.failed.azure-2: Go to Disks, and create new Disk using the identified Storage Blob.
Recovery.operation.failed.vmware-1: The storage disk will be attached to the recovery instance.
Recovery.operation.failed.vmware-2: Detach the OS disk from the recovery instance
opretion.failed.steps.with.syptoms-2: Attach the operating system disk/volume created above to the Datamotive Windows Prep Node.
rdp.into.prep.node.cred-desc: The default credentials for RDP are
after.rdp.node.step-1: Open Disk Management and locate the newly attached disk.
after.rdp.node.step-2: Make it online & note the drive letter of Windows disk. E.g. D:. The rest of the document assumes drive letter D:. In case the drive letter detected is different use the detected letter in the commands.
verify.reboot.pending.status.desc-update: Open Windows System Updates settings and confirm if there are any updates pending to be applied. If there are, then
machine.boots.up.repair.mode: 1. Machine boots up in Repair Mode
machine.boots.up.with.black.screen: 2. Machine boots up with Black Screen
title.troubleshoot.fix.workflow.steps.a: Attach the disk of failed instance in Datamotive Windows Prep Node
info.vmware.subnet: Enter subnet mask for virtual machine network
test.recovery.note: Test recoveries allow you to validate your replicated copy in target site. It is recommended to test recover workloads in an isolated VPC or subnet to avoid conflicts or race conditions in target environment. If there are recovery scripts which make changes like updating DNS entries etc., it is recommended to omit their execution during Test recovery to avoid unnecessary changes to the target environment
error.ackn.pplan.alert: Virtual Machine info not available in the event.
error.same.site: Protection and recovery sites cannot be same.
error.reverse.validation: Differential reverse replication is not possible for this protection plan as {{error}} . Please select full incremental for replication type.
vmware.diff.rev.warning: For VMware platform, differential reverse replication is supported only for the data disks. For the boot disk, full data will be replicated on reverse.
recovery.discard.warning.msg: Latest replication for VM vmName has not completed, it will be recovered from the last known good state. This operation might take time
reovery.discard.warning.txt: Latest replication for the below mentioned VM/s has not completed, it will be recovered from the last known good state.
recover.cloud.agent.warning: Please provide virtual machine's local administrator credentials to install system agents
recover.common.installation.warning: Please provide virtual machine's local administrator credentials to install agents
recover.cloud.agent.ip.warning: Please install system agent (VMware Tools) if recovery postscript requires IP address of recovered VM
title.cleanup.test.recovery: Select Workloads for Test Recovery Cleanup.
title.differntial.preserve.current: Preserve Current State (Recovery operation might exceed the RTO)
replication.priority.info: AWS has an account level limit on number of pending snapshots. The replications are queued in the system only if this platform limit is reached. When capacity to create more snapshots is available the replications will start based on the priority set.
vmware.quiesce.info: Enables file system consistent replications by using VMware Quiesced Snapshots. This requires VMware VM tools to be installed in the VM.
reset.disk.warning: Are you sure you want to resync replication for disk(s) ?
condition.to.execute.statement: Execute below remediation steps if you see following errors in Recovery Validation Step:
system.status.check.excute.conditions: Boot Partition Check, Disk Consistency Check, Registry Check
window.update.status.check.excute.condit: Windows Updates Store Health Check, Pending Installs In System, Pending Reboots In System
filesystem.status.check.excute.condition: Boot Partition Check, Disk Consistency Check, Registry Check, Boot Configuration Data Check
checkpoint.selection.error.msg: Select Point In Time Checkpoint For
cbt.warning: Ensure that there are no snapshots on the virtual machine before enabling CBT. If there are existing snapshots, VMware APIs might return incorrect changed block data and cause issues in incremental replications. For details, refer here
checkpoint.preserve.title: Preserve Checkpoint
resynk.disk.warning.with.checkpoint: This operation will delete latest disk/snapshot and create a new one to resync full data. Existing point-in-time checkpoints will not be impacted.
resynk.disk.warning.without.checkpoint: This operation will delete latest disk/snapshot and create a new one to resync full data.
info.recovery.username: Virtual machine's username to execute the pre and postscripts. If there are no scripts for the virtual machine, then credentials are not mandatory
info.recovery.password: Virtual Machine's password to execute the pre and postscripts. If there are no scripts for the virtual machine, then credentials are not mandatory
node.upgrade.text: To maintain system's stability, compatibility and security all node must operate on the same software version for seamless replication and optimal performance. Click and upgrade to upgrade node version associated with management node.
common.checkpoint.info: This field specifies the common time for virtual machine point-in-time copies.
report.duration.heading: Report Duration
maintain.original.example.statement.one: If VM Demo-1 is getting reversed, the same will be used for replication.
maintain.original.statement.one: The initial source VM will be used for replication.
maintain.original.statement.two: Latest changed data will be merged with original data.
create.new.copy.statement.one: A new copy of the initial source VM will be created.
create.new.copy.statement.two: Initial source VM will remain in the infrastructure with all of it's data.
create.new.copy.statement.three: Data will be replicated into the newly created VM.
create.new.copy.example.one: If VM Demo-1 is getting reversed, a new VM with name Demo-1-dm-reversed will be created and used for replication.
entity.type.info: Select 'Maintain Original Copy' to replicate to the original VM or select 'Create New Copy' to create a new VM and replicate data into the new VM.
reconfig.plan.azure.target: Changing virtual network will delete existing recovery entity and create new one.
reconfig.plan.aws.target: Making any changes to the primary network would delete the existing recovery entity and create a new one.
maintain.original.warning.two: For safety purpose, validate the health of the source VM.
maintain.original.warning.three: Ensure that the initial source VM is powered-off.
create.new.warning.one: Ensure that there is enough storage space available in target.
reverse.change.value.warning.msg.one: Recommended setting have been overridden for certain instances.
reverse.change.value.warning.msg.two: Please review and correct the replication settings accordingly to optimize resource utilization.
title.apply.recommended.button: Apply entity type and replication type in all virtual machines as recommended
create.new.warning.two: Please re-configure the network for IP Addresses.
script.warning.reverse: Please check and correct all the scripts depending on new source and target sites.
pit.recovery.warning: After recovering a virtual machine from a point-in-time checkpoint, it cannot be recovered again with the latest replicated data.
pit.disk.resize.warning.text: Taking action on this alert will delete all the available point-in-time checkpoints of {{vmName}} on VMware infra.
test.recovery.ip.warning.msg: To configure Static IP please specify credentials of local administrator account.
info.protectionplan.aws.tenancy: Shared Tenancy: Instances run on shared hardware with other customers. Ideal for cost-effective, standard workloads. Dedicated Host: Provides a physical server dedicated to your use. Suitable for compliance, licensing needs, or specific hardware requirements.
info.protectionplan.aws.tenancyBy: Host: to deploy instance on a dedicated host. Host Resource Group: to deploy instance on the host resource group, in this case depending on instance configuration dedicated host will be auto selected.
info.protectionplan.aws.host.arn: To Deploy workload on Dedicated Host provide the Dedicated Host ID. To Deploy workload on Host Resource Group provide the Host Resource Group ARN.
info.protectionplan.aws.host.affinity: When affinity is set to Host, an instance launched onto a specific host always restarts on the same host if stopped.
info.protectionplan.aws.ami: AMI Id which is associated with self-managed license.
info.protectionplan.aws.license: License configurations are AWS License Manager rule-sets that are associated with instances at launch to enforce license compliance. If no value is specified the value of the AMI will be used if associated.
pending.reason: Why recovery status move to Pending Platform Checks ?
pending.resolution.step.title: How to update the recovery status.
pending.resolution.step.1: Login to cloud console and confirm the system checks have passed.
pending.resolution.step.2: Review the system screenshot to confirm the Operating System has booted successfully.
pending.resolution.step.3: If the operating system is booted but the status checks have not passed, initiate a reboot and wait for the checks to complete.
pending.resolution.step.4: To mark recovery status in as Completed or Failed In the system navigate to Recovery Jobs and click Refresh Recovery Status and follow on screen instructions.
impact.description: Configured post recovery script for the instance will not be executed.
rec.rec.consent.text: Please confirm if you want to change the recovery status.
clean.recovery.pending.vm.warn: On finish the recovery status of the following virtual machine will be updated according to latest recovery status below.
full.test.workload.selection.warn: Workloads have been selected from both Full Recovery/Migration and Test Recovery. Please choose workloads from either Full Recovery/Migration or Test Recovery.
delete.vm.infra: Delete recovery instance from target infrastructure. [Recovered instances will not be deleted]
node.versions.mismatch.warning: Data sync for workloads is paused due to version mismatch on one or more Datamotive node(s). Upgrade applicable node(s) to version ({{localNodeversion}}).
workload.name: Workload Name
test.recovery.instance.warning: An IP conflict can occur if a previous Test Recovery instance remains active. This will cause the Test Recovery operation to fail.
